item.title: [Global][Live Chat]
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Jul 11, 18:00 - 20:00 UTC

Jul 9, 09:00 UTC
Scheduled - As part of our continuous improvement plan, maintenance is scheduled on the internal infrastructure.

This may temporarily affect your access to the Live Chat. A down time of 45 to 60 min is anticipated.

Start time : 11/07/2024 18:00 UTC
End time : 11/07/2024 20:00 UTC
Workaround : If you need assistance during the intervention hours, please create a ticket from your Help Center: https://help.ovhcloud.com/csm?id=csm_get_help

Thank you for your understanding.

item.title: [APAC][Support] - Support unreachable by phone
item.description:
Jul 11, 04:52 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 11/07/2024 02:09 UTC
End time : 11/07/2024 04:45 UTC
Service impact : The situation is back to normal, the service is running nominally.
Root cause : A software needed to be updated.

Jul 11, 03:52 UTC
Update - After dialing the support number, a list of choices is presented to select the type of request.
Choices 3 and 4 are now available.
Our teams are currently working to restore choices 1 and 2.

Jul 11, 03:11 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 11/07/2024 02:09 UTC
Service impact : Support is temporarily unreachable by phone via APAC lines
Ongoing actions : Investigating
Our technical teams are working on the issue. Update will be posted as significant progress is made.

item.title: [GLOBAL][Support] - ServiceNow OneGate (Production)/ Help Centre portal maintenance
item.description:
Jun 22, 14:44 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Jun 22, 06:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Jun 20, 16:04 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 22/06/2024 06:00 UTC
End time : 22/06/2024 16:00 UTC
Service impact : You may experience a punctual slowness or logoff of the application might be observed during the maintenance, Help Centre access could be degraded.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy, we will update the application to improve security and stability.
Workaround : Help Center will remain accessible https://help.ovhcloud.com along with the Manager https://www.ovh.com/manager.
If you have a Business or Enterprise level of support, your dedicated phone number is available to reach you technical advisor in case of emergency. You can also access our documentation directly on our GitHub repository : https://github.com/ovh/docs/blob/develop/pages/index.md

Jun 12, 08:12 UTC
Identified - The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

Jun 11, 13:40 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 07/06/2024 15:00 UTC
Service impact : Resource usage metrics related to CPU, RAM & network usage are not available in the OVHcloud Manager and APIv6 for VPS and Public cloud compute services in the affected regions.
Ongoing actions : Investigating
Our technical teams are working on the issue with the metrics availability in the affected regions (VPS: BHS2/BHS6/UK2/DE2/SGP2, PCI: RBX-A). Update will be posted as significant progress is made.

item.title: [EU][Control panel & API] - Manager degraded performance
item.description:
May 7, 15:33 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 20/03/2024 16:18 UTC
End time : 07/05/2024 15:20 UTC
The issue has now been fully resolved.
Team has pushed a global fix to allow add regions to now be quicker and working as intended.
Adding a new region should now take less than a minute to fully be activated.

Apr 19, 15:27 UTC
Update - Our team is still working on this incident.
Update on service impact: When adding a new region through the manager, you may experience errors up to 10 minutes when navigating in the manager. After maximum 10 minutes, the issue will be automatically resolved.

Future changes are coming to mitigate the problem. These changes are currently in testing phases and will be deployed as soon as possible.

Apr 9, 13:55 UTC
Update - Our teams are preparing a patch to mitigate this issue.
Maintenance notifications will be sent.
We apologize for any inconvenience caused.

Mar 25, 15:27 UTC
Update - We would like to update you on the current incident.

Our teams are working tirelessly to resolve this incident once and for all.

Mar 21, 14:25 UTC
Update - We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

Mar 20, 19:22 UTC
Identified - After a deep investigation by our technical teams, they found that local zones can be added by submitting a request from the manager, but will take more time than expected.
Our technical teams are currently preparing a fix to resolve the latency problem and the error message displayed on the manager which does not represent the actual status of the request.

Mar 20, 17:41 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 20/03/2024 16:18 UTC
Service impact : Adding a new region or local zone through the manager for the Public Cloud offer may fail
Ongoing actions : Investigating
Our technical teams are working on the issue. Update will be posted as significant progress is made.
